thread.title: Luis Enrique plays down Sergi Roberto injury
thread.title_full: Luis Enrique plays down Sergi Roberto injury

author: Lamar Odom reportedly released from Las Vegas hospital
title: Luis Enrique plays down Sergi Roberto injury
text:
Luis Enrique plays down Sergi Roberto injury Goal.com 8 hrs ago © Provided by Goal.com Barcelona was dealt another injury blow as Sergi Roberto was forced off in the first half of their Champions League game against BATE Borisov.
AdChoices Speaking after his side's 2-0 win, Luis Enrique said he was hopeful it is nothing too problematic.
“It [does not seem] very serious because he came off walking calmly," the Barca boss said, adding that "tomorrow the doctors will do their tests."
The midfielder pulled up chasing a misplaced Javier Mascherano pass and appeared to be holding his groin as he signaled to the bench that he was unable to continue.
With less than 20 minutes on the clock in Belarus, he was replaced by Croatian international Ivan Rakitic, who went on to score both his side's goals in the second half.
Andres Iniesta, Rafinha and Lionel Messi are all currently sidelined, so Barca will hope Roberto's injury doesn't prove too serious.
After deciding to stay at the club during the summer, the 23-year-old has impressed as both a right back and a central midfielder so far this season.
Tuesday night's match against BATE was his 12th appearance of the campaign already and his ninth start.
